title: Epic: Release & Publishing Automation
description: Implement python-semantic-release for automated versioning, create release.yml workflow, setup PyPI trusted publisher, automate CHANGELOG.md generation

title: Create .github/workflows/release.yml
description: Workflow for python-semantic-release: trigger after CI passes, create tags/releases, auto-generate CHANGELOG.md, use PyPI trusted publishing (id-token: write)

title: Configure PyPI trusted publisher
description: Setup at pypi.org/manage/account/publishing/ - Add pending publisher for mitre-repo-minder, owner: mitre, repo: repo-minder, workflow: release.yml

title: Document branch-based workflow
description: Add documentation explaining: create feature branches, use conventional commits (feat/fix/docs), create PRs, semantic-release auto-bumps version on merge to main

title: Create initial CHANGELOG.md
description: Create CHANGELOG.md following Keep a Changelog format, document v1.0.0 initial release with all features from SESSION01.md

title: PROJECT OVERVIEW: Repo Minder Modernization
description:
## Project Context

**What:** Modernize repo-minder (license standardization tool) to 2025 Python standards and add multi-file community health support.

**Current State:** v1.0.0 - Working tool that standardizes LICENSE.md across 240+ MITRE SAF repos with 69 passing tests.

**Goal:** Bring to modern standards, add docs/release automation, enable multi-file support (SECURITY.md, CODE_OF_CONDUCT.md, CONTRIBUTING.md).

## Key Documents
- MODERNIZATION_PLAN.md - Complete implementation plan (500+ lines)
- PYTHON_PROJECT_SETUP_GUIDE.md - 2025 Python standards reference
- SESSION01.md - v1.0.0 development history
- ROADMAP.md - Future features (v1.1.0+)

## Epic Structure (4 Epics, ~22-32 hours)

**Epic 1: Modernize to 2025 Python Standards (repo-minder-hxh)** - FOUNDATION
- Remove black, use ruff-only
- Python 3.12+ requirement
- Pre-commit hooks
- Modern CI workflow
- Dependencies: NONE (start here!)

**Epic 2: Documentation Infrastructure (repo-minder-rpb)** - PARALLEL
- MkDocs with Material theme
- GitHub Pages deployment
- User and developer guides
- Dependencies: Epic 1 complete

**Epic 3: Release & Publishing Automation (repo-minder-3r0)** - PARALLEL
- python-semantic-release
- PyPI trusted publisher
- Automated CHANGELOG.md
- Dependencies: Epic 1 complete

**Epic 4: Community Health & Multi-File Support (repo-minder-bn7)** - DOG-FOOD
- Create SECURITY.md, CODE_OF_CONDUCT.md, CONTRIBUTING.md templates
- Extend CLI to support multiple file types
- Use repo-minder on itself!
- Dependencies: Epic 1, 2, 3 complete

**Epic 5: Future Features (repo-minder-vcn)** - v1.1.0+
- Full multi-file support (all tech stacks)
- Template preview, fork management, policy enforcement
- Dependencies: Epic 4 complete

## Template Variables Extracted

From analyzing mitre/vulcan, mitre/heimdall2, mitre/train-k8s-container:

**Existing:** organization, team, case_number, copyright_org, copyright_year, org_office, org_address, org_phone

**New:** team_email (saf@mitre.org), security_email (saf-security@mitre.org), project_name, project_description

## Key Design Decisions

1. **LICENSE.md is unified** - Combines Apache 2.0 + NOTICE content in one file (no separate NOTICE.md)
2. **CODE_OF_CONDUCT.md is 100% identical** across all MITRE repos (Contributor Covenant v2.1)
3. **CHANGELOG.md is auto-generated** by release-please (not templated by us)
4. **External templates use ChoiceLoader** - Jinja2 ecosystem standard pattern

## Work Order

1. Start with Epic 1 (Foundation) - ALL tasks unblocked
2. Epic 2 & 3 can be done in parallel after Epic 1
3. Epic 4 requires all previous epics complete
4. Epic 5 is future work (post v1.1.0)

## Quick Start Commands

```bash
# See what's ready to work on
bd ready

# Show full task list
bd list

# Start working on a task
bd comment repo-minder-hxh.1 'Starting work on this'

# Mark task done
bd close repo-minder-hxh.1

# See epic dependencies
bd show repo-minder-hxh
```

## Success Metrics

- All 4 epics complete
- 2025 Python standards compliant
- Documentation deployed to GitHub Pages
- Automated releases to PyPI
- Community health files generated using repo-minder itself
- Ready for v1.1.0 release with multi-file support

## Timeline

Target: 4-6 working days (~22-32 hours total)

Last updated: 2026-01-01

comments.author: alippold
comments.text: This is a reference overview. Read this when returning to the project to quickly get back into context. See MODERNIZATION_PLAN.md for full details.

comments.author: alippold
comments.text: This overview stays open until all 4 epics are complete. Use 'bd show repo-minder-8lv' to get back into context when returning to this project.

comments.author: alippold
comments.text: CLOSE THIS CARD when all 4 priority epics (Epic 1-4) are complete and repo-minder v1.1.0 is released. This marks the entire modernization project as done.

title: Epic: Community Health & Compliance
description: Add SECURITY.md, CODE_OF_CONDUCT.md, NOTICE.md, CONTRIBUTING.md following MITRE standards and OSS best practices

title: Create SECURITY.md
description: Add security policy: reporting process (saf-security@mitre.org), response timeline (48hr ack, 7 day assessment), required info for vulnerability reports

title: Create CODE_OF_CONDUCT.md
description: Adopt Contributor Covenant v2.1, include contact: saf@mitre.org for code of conduct issues

title: Create NOTICE.md
description: Copyright notice: Copyright Â© 2025 The MITRE Corporation, Approved for Public Release; Distribution Unlimited. Case Number 18-3678, Apache License 2.0 reference

comments.author: alippold
comments.text: NOTICE.md is already unified into LICENSE.md per our design. No separate file needed.

title: Update README.md with badges and links
description: Add badges: PyPI version, Python version, CI status, codecov, License. Add links to new docs (SECURITY.md, CODE_OF_CONDUCT.md, documentation site)

title: Add template variables to Settings class
description: Add team_email, security_email, project_name, project_description to Settings class. Auto-detect project info from pyproject.toml. Update template variable passing in LicenseStandardizer.

title: Implement multi-file CLI support
description: Add --file-type option to CLI. Support: security, code-of-conduct, contributing, changelog. Implement file type detection and template selection logic.

title: Create CONTRIBUTING.md template (Python)
description: Create templates/CONTRIBUTING/python.md.j2 based on train-k8s-container and Vulcan examples. Include: dev setup, testing, linting (ruff), conventional commits.

title: Dog-food: Generate community files for repo-minder
description: Use repo-minder itself to generate SECURITY.md, CODE_OF_CONDUCT.md, CONTRIBUTING.md for this project. Validates the multi-file feature works correctly.

title: Epic: Modernize to 2025 Python Standards
description: Update project to follow PYTHON_PROJECT_SETUP_GUIDE.md: remove black (use ruff only), upgrade to Python 3.12+, update CI workflows, add pre-commit hooks

title: Update pyproject.toml: Remove black, add semantic-release config
description: Remove black from dev dependencies (ruff handles formatting), add python-semantic-release>=9.0.0 to build-system.requires, add [tool.semantic_release] configuration

title: Upgrade Python requirement to 3.12+
description: Update requires-python to '>=3.12', update classifiers, update CI matrix to test Python 3.12 and 3.13 only

title: Create .pre-commit-config.yaml
description: Add pre-commit hooks: trailing-whitespace, end-of-file-fixer, check-yaml, check-toml, ruff (lint+format), bandit. Use ruff-pre-commit v0.14.9+

title: Update CI workflow to match guide standards
description: Use setup-uv@v7, use 'uv run --frozen --all-extras', replace 'black --check' with 'ruff format --check', fix bandit command to scan repo_minder.py not standardize_licenses.py

title: Design: External template support
description: Research and design how users can provide custom templates. Use Jinja2 ChoiceLoader pattern: --template-dir flag, user templates override bundled, FileSystemLoader + PackageLoader precedence. Document in docs/developer-guide/custom-templates.md

title: Epic: Future Features (ROADMAP.md)
description: Track future enhancements from ROADMAP.md: v1.1.0 Standard Files Support, v1.2.0 Template Preview, v1.3.0 Fork Management, v2.0.0+ Policy Enforcement

title: Epic: Documentation Infrastructure
description: Create MkDocs documentation with Material theme, setup GitHub Pages deployment, write getting-started and developer guides

title: Create docs/ directory structure
description: Create docs/index.md, docs/getting-started.md, docs/developer-guide/contributing.md, docs/developer-guide/release-process.md

title: Create mkdocs.yml configuration
description: Setup Material theme, configure nav structure, add mermaid diagram support, configure site metadata (name, url, repo link)

title: Create .github/workflows/docs.yml
description: Workflow to build MkDocs and deploy to GitHub Pages, trigger after successful release, use mkdocs-material and mkdocs-autorefs

title: Write documentation content
description: Populate index.md with project overview, getting-started.md with installation/quick-start, contributing.md with dev workflow, release-process.md with semver/publishing process

title: Epic: Multi-File Support (v1.1.0)
description: Extend tool beyond LICENSE to standardize all community health files: NOTICE.md, CODE_OF_CONDUCT.md, SECURITY.md, CONTRIBUTING.md, CHANGELOG.md. Use existing template detection logic, add --file-type option, support custom templates per file type

title: Dog-food: Use repo-minder to create community files for itself
description: Use the multi-file support feature to generate SECURITY.md, CODE_OF_CONDUCT.md, NOTICE.md for this project. Validates the feature works and provides real-world testing
